lead_paragraph: A federal law enforcement official said the intrusion appeared to have come from that country’s intelligence services.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt and David E. Sanger contributed reporting from Aspen, Colo.

headline.print_headline: Russian Spies  Said to Hack  Clinton’s Bid
headline.main: Computer Systems Used by Clinton Campaign Are Said to Be Hacked, Apparently by Russians

snippet: A federal law enforcement official said the intrusion appeared to have come from that country’s intelligence services....
abstract: Federal officials report computer systems used by Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign were hacked, with breach appearing to be of Russian origin; attack appears to have come from same entity that compromised Democratic National Committee's computer system, adding to Clinton team's arguments that Russia is trying to influence outcome of American presidential election.
